meanings.definition: Fastened or closed with a zipper.
meanings.sent1: Her zippered jacket kept her warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: The zippered bag securely held all her belongings.
meanings.sent3: He tried to wear a zippered shoe on his hand, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The zippered sky seemed to hold all the stars in place.
meanings.sent5: The zippered door made a satisfying sound when opened.

meanings.sent1: The zippered purse had compartments for all her items.
meanings.sent2: She loved her new zippered wallet for its convenience.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly wore a zippered hat on his foot.
meanings.sent4: The zippered backpack was like a portable storage unit.
meanings.sent5: The zippered jacket made it easy to adjust the temperature.

meanings.definition: To close or fasten with a zipper.
meanings.sent1: She zippered her coat before heading out into the snow.
meanings.sent2: He zippered the bag shut to keep everything safe inside.
meanings.sent3: The magician zippered the rabbit into the hat for a surprise trick.
meanings.sent4: He zippered his lips, indicating he wouldn't reveal the secret.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her zippering the dress filled the room with anticipation.
